results.title: The Boy and the pelican
results.creator_credit: Arden Winch, Wessex Film Productions and Geoffrey Gurnan
results.brief_description: Pedro a pampered pelican lives happily on a Greek island until the arrival of a small boy called Hiko. Pedro is then forgotten by the islanders. He tries to fly away but is too bloated to succeed. On his return Pedro is seen by Niko who falls in love with him. Pedro is now completely happy.

results.title: The Boy and the North Wind
results.brief_description: A puppet animation film about greed and justice. A young boy receives three presents from the North Wind and each one is stolen by a greedy landlord. Finally the North Wind gives the boy a present that punishes the greedy landlord.

results.title: The Boy and the cat
results.brief_description: An animated children’s Christmas fantasy about the adventures of a boy and his cat. No narration - music only. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

results.title: The Bottom Rung
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
This program reports from Bangladesh, Tanzania and Brazil and highlights the extreme poverty there. It poses the question ‘Can the gap between rich world and poor world ever be closed?’

results.title: The Borders: where Scotland and England meet
results.creator_credit: Robin Crichton, Edinburgh Film Productions and Mike Pavett
results.brief_description: Examines the agricultural and industrial development of the border regions of Scotland and England, and the growth of new houses and educational institutions. Highlights projects which have been implemented to attract population and encourage young people to stay instead of seeking careers and employment elsewhere.

results.title: The Book Place

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

results.description: The Book Place was an educational TV show for children, which aired on the Seven Network from 1991 to 2003. The show was originally presented by former host of Fat Cat and Friends, Lynn Weston with Brenton Whittle, and Andy Armstrong, with Michael Scheld as the Bookworm.
description_for_label: The Book Place was an educational TV show for children, which aired on the Seven Network from 1991 to 2003. The show was originally presented by former host of Fat Cat and Friends, Lynn Weston with Brenton Whittle, and Andy Armstrong, with Michael Scheld as the Bookworm.

results.title: The Book keeper
results.brief_description: In an out of the way, old fashioned book shop, an eccentric proprietor defends his books from the predation of time, insects and occasional customers. Upstairs his crippled Granny remains addicted to tinned Irish stew and televised rock and roll wrestling until, that is , she is invaded by a bizarre literary book worm which infects her with a desire for TS Eliot. The Book Keeper loves his books and will do anything to protect them, even murder, but his tiny world is turned around when he catches his granny chewing on a few volumes of TS Eliot.

results.title: The Booby prize
results.creator_credit: Christopher Myline, British Broadcasting Corporation and Bryan Nelson
results.brief_description: Christmas Island is immensely rich in phosphate fertilizer, and is one of the finest seabird islands in the world. Phosphate mining is destroying the habitat of the seabirds, and endangering the survival of such rare species as “Abbott’s Boobies”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Myline, British Broadcasting Corporation and Bryan Nelson

results.title: The Bonne Bell Mini Marathon
results.creator_credit: Yvonne Hannemann and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: A film about the Bonne Bell Mini Marathon, an all-women event which took place in Central Park, New York. Hundreds of women of all ages took part - from serious runners to those who entered just for the enjoyment.
